en.purpose: To record details about a single job or role carried out by an individual during a specified period of time.
en.use:
Use to record details about a single job or role carried out by an individual during a specified period of time. 

The scope of this archetype is inclusive of all occupations or activities undertaken by an individual. For example: a paid job or employment; unpaid work of any type such as a volunteer position; or roles such as being retired or a student. 

Multiple instances of this archetype captured over time will result in the aggregation of a history of past and present jobs and/or roles.

An active, or current occupation may be implied from a 'Date commenced' but no 'Date ceased'. 

An individual may carry out many simultaneous occupations, each of which may be paid or unpaid. Each occupation should be recorded in a separate instance of this archetype.

If occupation attributes change significantly, such as a change of role/title or number of hours, then this should be recorded as a separate instance of this archetype.

This archetype has been specifically designed to be used in the 'Occupation episode' SLOT within the EVALUATION.occupation_summary archetype, but can also be used within any other ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes, where clinically appropriate.

There may be some apparent or real overlap between the data elements in this archetype and occupation/employment details that may be stored as demographic details in clinical or administrative systems. These data elements have been designed specifically to support clinical purposes including generation of a medical certificate to a current employer.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record temporary changes or episodes within a single occupation record, such as being on leave. This is out of scope for this archetype and should be part of an employer's human relations system.

Not to be used for detailed descriptions of health risks or exposure to hazardous substances in the workplace. Use the archetypes EVALUATION.health_risk or EVALUATION.exposure for this purpose.

Not to be used to record information about sources of income or income details for the individual. Use the EVALUATION.income_summary archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record information about the occupation of an individual at a specific point in time (for example, on June 16, 2014) or during a relative interval of time (for example 'in the past 30 days'. Use an appropriate OBSERVATION archetype for this purpose.
en.copyright: © Australian Digital Health Agency, openEHR Foundation, Nasjonal IKT HF

it.purpose: Registrare i dettagli della singola professione svolta o ruolo ricoperto da un individuo durante un determinato periodo di tempo.
keywords: lavoro, impiego, datore di lavoro, occupazione, disoccupazione, professione, disoccupato, occupato, dipendente, impiegato, studente, settore, volontario, vocazione, mestiere, lavoratore, posizione
it.use:
Usato per registrare i dettagli della singola professione svolta o ruolo ricoperto da un individuo durante un determinato periodo di tempo.

L'ambito di questo archetipo comprende tutte le occupazioni o attività svolte da un individuo. Ad esempio: un lavoro o impiego retribuiti; un qualsiasi lavoro non retribuito, come un'attività di volontariato; o ruoli come essere in pensione o uno studente. 

Più istanze di questo archetipo catturate nel tempo possono essere aggregate per costruire la storia occupazionale di un individuo, che comprende occupazioni e ruoli passati e presenti.

È possibile dedurre se l'occupazione sia attiva/corrente se è presente una 'Data di inizio' ma non una 'Data di cessazione'.

Un individuo può avere più occupazioni contemporaneamente, ciascuna delle quali può essere retribuita o meno. Ogni occupazione dovrebbe essere registrata in una istanza separata di questo archetipo. 

Se i dettagli dell'occupazione cambiano significativamente, ad esempio in caso di modifica del ruolo/titolo o numero di ore, questo dovrebbe corrispondere ad un'istanza separata di questo archetipo.

Questo archetipo è stato sviluppato per essere usato nello SLOT 'Episodio lavorativo' all'interno dell'archetipo EVALUATION.occupation_summary, ma è possibile utilizzarlo all'interno di altri archetipi di tipo ENTRY o CLUSTER quando clinicamente appropriato. 

Ci potrebbe essere una sovrapposizione, apparente o reale, tra i dati all'interno di questo archetipo e i dettegli sull'occupazione/impiego memorizzati come informazioni demografiche all'interno di sistemi clinici o amministrativi.  I contenuti sono stati espressamente progettati per supportare l'attività clinica, compresa la generazione di certificati medici per un datore di lavoro.
it.misuse:
Non utilizzare per memorizzare cambiamenti o episodi temporanei all'interno di un singolo record di occupazione, come ad esempio essere in congedo. Questo non rientra nello scopo dell'archetipo e dovrebbe far parte del sistema di gestione delle risorse umane del datore di lavoro. 

Non utilizzare per descrizioni dettagliate dei rischi per la salute o dell'esposizione a sostanze pericolose nel luogo di lavoro. Utilizzare invece gli archetipi EVALUATION.health_risk o EVALUATION.exposure.

Non utilizzare per memorizzare informazioni sulle fonti o dettagli del reddito dell'individuo. Per questo scopo, utilizzare l'archetipo EVALUATION.income_summary.

Non utilizzare per memorizzare informazioni sull'occupazione di un individuo in uno specifico punto nel tempo (ad esempio, il 16 giugno 2014) o durante un intervallo di tempo (ad esempio 'negli ultimi 30 giorni'). Per questo scopo, usare un appropriato archetipo di tipo OBSERVATION.

fr.purpose: Un travail ou un rôle unique exercé par un individu pendant une période de temps déterminée.
fr.use:
*Use to record details about a single job or role carried out by an individual during a specified period of time. 

The scope of this archetype is inclusive of all occupations or activities undertaken by an individual. For example: a paid job or employment; unpaid work of any type such as a volunteer position; or roles such as being retired or a student. 

Multiple instances of this archetype captured over time will result in the aggregation of a history of past and present jobs and/or roles.

An active, or current occupation may be implied from a 'Date commenced' but no 'Date ceased'. 

An individual may carry out many simultaneous occupations, each of which may be paid or unpaid. Each occupation should be recorded in a separate instance of this archetype.

If occupation attributes change significantly, such as a change of role/title or number of hours, then this should be recorded as a separate instance of this archetype.

This archetype has been specifically designed to be used in the 'Occupation episode' SLOT within the EVALUATION.occupation_summary archetype, but can also be used within any other ENTRY or CLUSTER archetypes, where clinically appropriate.

There may be some apparent or real overlap between the data elements in this archetype and occupation/employment details that may be stored as demographic details in clinical or administrative systems. These data elements have been designed specifically to support clinical purposes including generation of a medical certificate to a current employer.(en)
fr.misuse:
*Not to be used to record temporary changes or episodes within a single occupation record, such as being on leave. This is out of scope for this archetype and should be part of an employer's human relations system.

Not to be used for detailed descriptions of health risks or exposure to hazardous substances in the workplace. Use the archetypes EVALUATION.health_risk or EVALUATION.exposure for this purpose.

Not to be used to record information about sources of income or income details for the individual. Use the EVALUATION.income_summary archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record information about the occupation of an individual at a specific point in time (for example, on June 16, 2014) or during a relative interval of time (for example 'in the past 30 days'. Use an appropriate OBSERVATION archetype for this purpose.(en)

es.purpose: Para registrar detalles sobre un trabajo o rol llevado a cabo por un individuo durante un periodo de tiempo especificado.
es.use:
Usar para registrar detalles sobre un trabajo o rol particular llevado a cabo por un individuo durante un periodo de tiempo especificado.

El alcance de este arquetipo incluye todos los empleos o actividades llevadas a cabo por el individuo. Por ejemplo: Un trabajo o empleo pagado; trabajo no remunerado de cualquier tipo como voluntario; o roles tales como estar jubilado o ser estudiante.

Múltiples instancias de este arquetipo capturadas a lo largo del tiempo resultarán en una agregación de un histórico de trabajos y/o roles presentes o pasados.

Un trabajo actual puede deducirse de la 'Fecha empezado' pero no de la 'Fecha finalizado'.

Un individuo puede llevar a cabo muchas ocupaciones al mismo tiempo, las cuales pueden ser remuneradas o no remuneradas. Cada ocupación debería de ser registrada en una instancia separada de este arquetipo.

Si los atributos de la ocupación cambian significativamente, tales como cambios en el título/rol o el número de horas, éstas se deberían de registrar en una instancia separada de este arquetipo.

Este arquetipo ha sido específicamente diseñado para ser usado en el SLOT de 'Episodio de ocupación' dentro del arquetipo EVALUATION.occupation_summary, pero también puede ser usado dentro de cualquier otro arquetipo ENTRY o CLUSTER, cuando sea clínicamente apropiado.

Puede haber una superposición aparente o real entre los elementos de datos en este arquetipo y detalles sobre la ocupación/empleo que puedan haber sido incluidos como detalles demográficos en sistemas clínicos o administrativos. Estos elementos de datos se han diseñado específicamente para dar soporte a propósitos clínicos como puede ser la generación de un certificado médico para el empleador actual.
es.misuse:
No debe ser usado para registrar cambios temporales o episodios dentro de un único registro ocupacional, tales como estar de baja. Esto está fuera del alcance de este arquetipo y debería ser parte de un sistema de recursos humanos del empleador.

No debe ser usado para una descripción detallada de los riesgos de salud o exposición a sustancias nocivas en el lugar de trabajo. Para este propósito use los arquetipos EVALUATION.health_risk o EVALUATION.exposure.

No debe ser usado para registrar información sobre fuentes o detalles de ingresos de un individuo. Para este propósito use el arquetipo EVALUATION.income_summary.

No debe ser usado para registrar información sobre la ocupación de un individuo en un punto concreto de tiempo (por ejemplo, el 16 de Junio de 2014) o durante un periodo de tiempo relativo (por ejemplo 'durante los últimos 30 días'). Para este propósito use un arquetipo OBSERVATION adecuado.

at0000.description: A single job or role carried out by an individual during a specified period of time.

at0001.description: The status of a worker in terms of being paid or unpaid.
at0001.comment: For example: unpaid; paid; self-employed; or volunteer. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

at0002.description: The type of industry in which the individual works.
at0002.comment: For example: Mining, manufacturing, construction. Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible.

at0004.description: Details about the employer or institution.

at0005.description: The main job title or the role of the individual.
at0005.comment: For example: Chief Executive Officer; Carer; or Student. Each of these job titles or roles may be comprised of multiple duties.

at0006.description: The type of job undertaken by the individual.
at0006.comment:
Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible, such as ISCO-08.
For example: Sales manager or software engineer.

at0007.description: The date when an individual commenced the job or role.

at0008.description: The date when an individual ceased working in a job or role.

at0013.description: The time spent in this job or role relative to full-time.
at0013.comment: Full time equivalent may also be known as 'FTE'. For example: 0.5; 50 %; or "part time".

at0014.description: Additional narrative about the occupation record not captured in other fields.

at0016.description: Narrative description about the job or role carried out by the individual.

at0018.description: Further detail about an occupation record.
at0018.comment: For example: workplace location and conditions; or combat zone experience.

at0019.description: The amount of time an individual is allocated to carry out the job or role per specified period of this occupation record.
at0019.comment: For example: '3 days per week', '10 days per month' or '2 hours per day'.

at0020.description: The individual carries out this occupation for equal to or more than the amount of time that is officially regarded as 'full-time' for the occupation.

at0021.description: The individual carries out this occupation for less than the amount of time that is officially regarded as 'full-time' for the occupation.

at0000.description: En jobb eller rolle individet har, eller har hatt i en spesifisert tidsperiode.

at0001.description: Om individet har lønnet eller ulønnet arbeid.

at0007.1.description: Datoen arbeidsforholdet/rollen startet.

at0008.1.description: Datoen arbeidsforholdet/rollen opphørte.

at0019.1.description: Den avtalte tiden som er satt av til å utføre jobben eller rollen per tidsperiode for dette arbeidsforholdet.
at0019.1.comment: For eksempel: "3 dager per uke", "10 dager per måned" eller "2 timer per dag".

at0000.1.description: En jobb eller rolle individet har, eller har hatt i en spesifisert tidsperiode.

at0001.1.description: Om individet har lønnet eller ulønnet arbeid.
at0001.1.comment: For eksempel: "Ulønnet", "Lønnet", "Selvstendig næringsdrivende" eller "Frivillig arbeid". Koding av denne statusen med en terminologi er anbefalt, der det er mulig.

at0000.description: Singola professione svolta o ruolo ricoperto da un individuo durante un determinato periodo di tempo.

at0001.description: Lo status di un lavoratore in termini di retribuzione o non retribuzione.
at0001.comment:
Ad esempio:  non retribuito; retribuito; lavoratore autonomo; o volontario. 

Si preferisce, ove possibile, la codifica con una terminologia.

at0002.description: Il settore dell'azienda in cui l'individuo lavora.
at0002.comment:
Ad esempio: Estrazione, produzione, costruzione.

Si preferisce, ove possibile, la codifica con una terminologia.

at0004.description: Dettagli sul datore di lavoro o sull'azienda.

at0005.description: La qualifica professionale o il ruolo dell'individuo.
at0005.comment: Ad esempio: Amminstratore delegato; Assistente; o Studente. Ciascuna qualifica o ruolo può comprendere più mansioni.

at0006.description: Il tipo di lavoro svolto dall'individuo.
at0006.comment:
La codifica con una terminologia è preferibile, quando possibile, ad esempio attraverso la ISCO-08.

Ad esempio: Responsabile delle vendite o ingegnere del software.

at0007.description: Data in cui l'individuo a iniziato ad esercitare la professione o ricoprire il ruolo.

at0008.description: Data in cui l'individuo a terminato di esercitare la professione o ricoprire il ruolo.

at0013.description: La porzione di tempo dedicato a questa professione/ruolo rispetto al tempo pieno.
at0013.comment:
L' equivalente a tempo pieno è anche conosciuto come 'FTE' - Full time equivalent.

Ad esempio:  0.5; 50 %; o "part time".

at0014.description: Note aggiuntive sull'occupazione non rilevate dagli altri campi.

at0016.description: Descrizione narrativa della professione svolta o del ruolo ricoperto dall'individuo.

at0018.description: Ulteriori dettagli sull'occupazione.
at0018.comment: Ad esempio: l'ubicazione del posto di lavoro e le condizioni; o esperienza in zone di combattimento.

at0019.description: Il tempo assegnato all'individuo per svolgere la professione/ruolo nel periodo specificato.
at0019.comment: Ad esempio: '3 giorni a settimana', '10 giorni al mese' o '2 ore al giorno'.

at0020.description: Il lavoro è svolto per un periodo di tempo pari o superiore a quello ufficialmente considerato a "tempo pieno" per l'occupazione.

at0021.description: Il lavoro è svolto per un periodo di tempo inferiore a quello ufficialmente considerato a "tempo pieno" per l'occupazione.

at0013.1.description: La porzione di tempo dedicato a questa professione/ruolo rispetto al tempo pieno.
at0013.1.comment:
L' equivalente a tempo pieno è anche conosciuto come 'FTE' - Full time equivalent.

Ad esempio:  0.5; 50 %; o "part time".

at0002.1.description: Il settore dell'azienda in cui l'individuo lavora.
at0002.1.comment:
Ad esempio: Estrazione, produzione, costruzione.

Si preferisce, ove possibile, la codifica con una terminologia.

at0014.1.description: Note aggiuntive sull'occupazione non rilevate dagli altri campi.

at0005.1.description: La qualifica professionale o il ruolo dell'individuo.
at0005.1.comment: Ad esempio: Amminstratore delegato; Assistente; o Studente. Ciascuna qualifica o ruolo può comprendere più mansioni.

at0016.1.description: Descrizione narrativa della professione svolta o del ruolo ricoperto dall'individuo.

at0006.1.description: Il tipo di lavoro svolto dall'individuo.
at0006.1.comment:
La codifica con una terminologia è preferibile, quando possibile, ad esempio attraverso la ISCO-08.

Ad esempio: Responsabile delle vendite o ingegnere del software.

at0007.1.description: Data in cui l'individuo a iniziato ad esercitare la professione o ricoprire il ruolo.

at0008.1.description: Data in cui l'individuo a terminato di esercitare la professione o ricoprire il ruolo.

at0019.1.description: Il tempo assegnato all'individuo per svolgere la professione/ruolo nel periodo specificato.
at0019.1.comment: Ad esempio: '3 giorni a settimana', '10 giorni al mese' o '2 ore al giorno'.

at0000.1.description: Singola professione svolta o ruolo ricoperto da un individuo durante un determinato periodo di tempo.

at0001.1.description: Lo status di un lavoratore in termini di retribuzione o non retribuzione.
at0001.1.comment:
Ad esempio:  non retribuito; retribuito; lavoratore autonomo; o volontario. 

Si preferisce, ove possibile, la codifica con una terminologia.

at0000.description: Un único trabajo o rol llevado a cabo por un individuo durante un periodo de tiempo especificado.

at0001.description: El estado de un trabajador en términos de ser pagado o no pagado.
at0001.comment: Por ejemplo: no remunerado; autoempelado; o voluntario. Se recomienda codificarlo con una terminología donde sea posible.

at0002.description: El tipo de sector industrial en el que trabaja el individuo.
at0002.comment: Por ejemplo: Minería, Fabricación, Construcción. Donde sea posible se recomienda codificar con una terminología.

at0004.description: Detalles sobre el empleador o institución.

at0005.description: El cargo, puesto o rol del individuo
at0005.comment: Por ejemplo: Director ejecutivo; Cuidador; o Estudiante. Cada uno de estos cargos o roles pueden estar compuestos de muchos deberes.

at0006.description: El tipo de trabajo llevado a cabo por el individuo.
at0006.comment: Donde sea posible se recomienda codificar con una terminología, tal como CIUO-08

at0007.description: La fecha en la que un individuo inicia el trabajo o rol.

at0008.description: La fecha cuando un individuo deja de trabajar en un trabajo o rol.

at0013.description: El tiempo usado en este trabajo o rol relativo a tiempo completo.
at0013.comment: El tiempo completo puede ser también conocido como 'ETC'. Por ejemplo: 0.5; 50 %; o "tiempo parcial"

at0014.description: Narrativa adiciona sobre el registro de ocupación no capturada en otros campos.

at0016.description: Descripción narrativa sobre el trabajo o rol llevado a cabo por el individuo.

at0018.description: Información adicional sobre un registro ocupacional.
at0018.comment: Por ejemplo: Localización y condiciones del lugar de trabajo; o experiencia en zona de combate.

at0019.description: La cantidad de tiempo que se le asigna a un individuo para llevar a cabo el trabajo o rol por periodo específico de su registro ocupacional.
at0019.comment: Por ejemplo: '3 días a la semana', '10 días al mes' o '2 horas al día'

at0020.description: El individuo lleva a cabo su ocupación por un tiempo igual o superior al oficialmente establecido como 'tiempo completo' para dicha ocupación.

at0021.description: El individuo lleva a cabo su ocupación por un tiempo menor al oficialmente establecido como 'tiempo completo' para dicha ocupación.

at0013.1.description: El tiempo usado en este trabajo o rol relativo a tiempo completo.
at0013.1.comment: El tiempo completo puede ser también conocido como 'ETC'. Por ejemplo: 0.5; 50 %; o "tiempo parcial"

at0002.1.description: El tipo de sector industrial en el que trabaja el individuo.
at0002.1.comment: Por ejemplo: Minería, Fabricación, Construcción. Donde sea posible se recomienda codificar con una terminología.

at0014.1.description: Narrativa adiciona sobre el registro de ocupación no capturada en otros campos.

at0005.1.description: El cargo, puesto o rol del individuo
at0005.1.comment: Por ejemplo: Director ejecutivo; Cuidador; o Estudiante. Cada uno de estos cargos o roles pueden estar compuestos de muchos deberes.

at0016.1.description: Descripción narrativa sobre el trabajo o rol llevado a cabo por el individuo.

at0006.1.description: El tipo de trabajo llevado a cabo por el individuo.
at0006.1.comment: Donde sea posible se recomienda codificar con una terminología, tal como CIUO-08

at0007.1.description: La fecha en la que un individuo inicia el trabajo o rol.

at0008.1.description: La fecha cuando un individuo deja de trabajar en un trabajo o rol.

at0019.1.description: La cantidad de tiempo que se le asigna a un individuo para llevar a cabo el trabajo o rol por periodo específico de su registro ocupacional.
at0019.1.comment: Por ejemplo: '3 días a la semana', '10 días al mes' o '2 horas al día'

at0000.1.description: Un único trabajo o rol llevado a cabo por un individuo durante un periodo de tiempo especificado.

at0001.1.description: El estado de un trabajador en términos de ser pagado o no pagado.
at0001.1.comment: Por ejemplo: no remunerado; autoempelado; o voluntario. Se recomienda codificarlo con una terminología donde sea posible.

at0000.description: Ein einzelner Job oder eine einzelne Rolle, die von einer Person während eines bestimmten Zeitraums ausgeführt wurde.

at0001.description: Der Status eines Arbeitnehmers in Bezug auf bezahlt oder unbezahlt.
at0001.comment: Zum Beispiel: unbezahlt, bezahlt, Selbstständiger oder Ehrenamtlicher. Eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie ist nach Möglichkeit wünschenswert.

at0002.description: Die Art der Branche, in der die Person arbeitet.
at0002.comment: Zum Beispiel: Bergbau, Fertigung, Bau. Eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie ist nach Möglichkeit wünschenswert.

at0004.description: Angaben zum Arbeitgeber oder zur Einrichtung.

at0005.description: Die Hauptberufsbezeichnung oder die Rolle der Person.
at0005.comment: Zum Beispiel: Geschäftsführer, Pflegekraft oder Student. Jede dieser Berufsbezeichnungen oder Rollen kann aus mehreren Aufgaben bestehen.

at0006.description: Die Art des Jobs der Person.
at0006.comment:
Eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie ist nach Möglichkeit wünschenswert, z. B. mit ISCO-08.
Zum Beispiel: Vertriebsleiter oder Softwareentwickler.

at0007.description: Das Datum, an dem eine Person mit dem Job oder der Rolle begonnen hat.

at0008.description: Das Datum, an dem eine Person mit einem Job oder einer Rolle aufgehört hat.

at0013.description: Die Zeit, die in diesem Job oder dieser Rolle im Verhältnis zur Vollzeit verbracht wurde.
at0013.comment: Vollzeitäquivalent kann auch als "FTE" (Full-Time Equivalent) bezeichnet werden. Zum Beispiel: 0,5; 50%; oder "Teilzeit".

at0014.description: Zusätzliche Beschreibung zur Beschäftigung, die nicht in anderen Feldern erfasst wurde.

at0016.description: Beschreibung des Jobs oder der Rolle der Person.

at0018.description: Weitere Angaben zu einer Beschäftigung.
at0018.comment: Zum Beispiel: Standort und Bedingungen am Arbeitsplatz oder Kampfzonenerfahrung.

at0019.description: Die Zeit, die einer Person für die Ausführung des Jobs oder der Rolle pro festgelegten Zeitraum dieser Beschäftigung zugewiesen wird.
at0019.comment: Zum Beispiel: "3 Tage pro Woche", "10 Tage pro Monat" oder "2 Stunden pro Tag".

at0020.description: Die Person übt diese Beschäftigung mindestens so lange aus, wie diese offiziell als „Vollzeit“ für die Beschäftigung gilt.

at0021.description: Die Person übt diese Beschäftigung weniger als die Zeit aus, die offiziell als "Vollzeit" für die Beschäftigung gilt.

at0013.1.description: Die Zeit, die in diesem Job oder dieser Rolle im Verhältnis zur Vollzeit verbracht wurde.
at0013.1.comment: Vollzeitäquivalent kann auch als "FTE" (Full-Time Equivalent) bezeichnet werden. Zum Beispiel: 0,5; 50%; oder "Teilzeit".

at0002.1.description: Die Art der Branche, in der die Person arbeitet.
at0002.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: Bergbau, Fertigung, Bau. Eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie ist nach Möglichkeit wünschenswert.

at0014.1.description: Zusätzliche Beschreibung zur Beschäftigung, die nicht in anderen Feldern erfasst wurde.

at0005.1.description: Die Hauptberufsbezeichnung oder die Rolle der Person.
at0005.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: Geschäftsführer, Pflegekraft oder Student. Jede dieser Berufsbezeichnungen oder Rollen kann aus mehreren Aufgaben bestehen.

at0016.1.description: Beschreibung des Jobs oder der Rolle der Person.

at0006.1.description: Die Art des Jobs der Person.
at0006.1.comment:
Eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie ist nach Möglichkeit wünschenswert, z. B. mit ISCO-08.
Zum Beispiel: Vertriebsleiter oder Softwareentwickler.

at0007.1.description: Das Datum, an dem eine Person mit dem Job oder der Rolle begonnen hat.

at0008.1.description: Das Datum, an dem eine Person mit einem Job oder einer Rolle aufgehört hat.

at0019.1.description: Die Zeit, die einer Person für die Ausführung des Jobs oder der Rolle pro festgelegten Zeitraum dieser Beschäftigung zugewiesen wird.
at0019.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: "3 Tage pro Woche", "10 Tage pro Monat" oder "2 Stunden pro Tag".

at0000.1.description: Ein einzelner Job oder eine einzelne Rolle, die von einer Person während eines bestimmten Zeitraums ausgeführt wurde.

at0001.1.description: Der Status eines Arbeitnehmers in Bezug auf bezahlt oder unbezahlt.
at0001.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: unbezahlt, bezahlt, Selbstständiger oder Ehrenamtlicher. Eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie ist nach Möglichkeit wünschenswert.

at0000.description: Un travail ou un rôle unique exercé par un individu pendant une période de temps déterminée.

at0001.description: Le statut d'un travailleur en termes de rémunération ou d'absence de rémunération.
at0001.comment: Par exemple : non rémunéré, rémunéré, indépendant ou bénévole. Il est souhaitable de coder avec une terminologie, lorsque cela est possible.

at0002.description: Le type d'industrie dans laquelle l'individu travaille.
at0002.comment: Par exemple : Mines, industrie manufacturière, construction. Il est souhaitable de coder avec une terminologie, lorsque cela est possible.

at0004.description: Détails sur l'employeur ou l'institution.

at0005.description: Le titre principal de l'emploi ou le rôle de l'individu.
at0005.comment: Par exemple : Directeur général, soignant ou étudiant. Chacun de ces titres ou rôles peut comporter plusieurs fonctions.

at0006.description: Le type d'emploi occupé par l'individu.
at0006.comment: Il est souhaitable d'utiliser, dans la mesure du possible, une terminologie telle que la CITP-08. Par exemple : Directeur des ventes ou ingénieur en logiciel.

at0007.description: La date à laquelle l'individu a commencé l'emploi ou la fonction.

at0008.description: La date à laquelle une personne a cessé de travailler dans un emploi ou une fonction.

at0013.description: Le temps passé dans cet emploi ou cette fonction par rapport à un emploi à temps plein.
at0013.comment: L'équivalent temps plein peut également être appelé "ETP". Par exemple : 0,5 ; 50 % ; ou "temps partiel".

at0014.description: Une description supplémentaire de l'enregistrement de la profession qui n'a pas été saisie dans d'autres champs.

at0016.description: Description de l'emploi ou du la fonction exercé par la personne.

at0018.description: Plus de détails sur la fiche d'occupation.
at0018.comment: Par exemple : lieu et conditions de travail ; ou expérience dans une zone de combat.

at0019.description: Le temps alloué à une personne pour exercer l'emploi ou la fonction par période spécifiée dans cette fiche de profession.
at0019.comment: Par exemple : "3 jours par semaine", "10 jours par mois" ou "2 heures par jour".

at0020.description: La personne exerce cette profession pendant une durée égale ou supérieure à la durée officiellement considérée comme "à temps plein" pour cette profession.

at0021.description: L'individu exerce cette profession pendant une durée inférieure à celle qui est officiellement considérée comme "à temps plein" pour cette profession

at0013.1.description: Le temps passé dans cet emploi ou cette fonction par rapport à un emploi à temps plein.
at0013.1.comment: L'équivalent temps plein peut également être appelé "ETP". Par exemple : 0,5 ; 50 % ; ou "temps partiel".

at0002.1.description: Le type d'industrie dans laquelle l'individu travaille.
at0002.1.comment: Par exemple : Mines, industrie manufacturière, construction. Il est souhaitable de coder avec une terminologie, lorsque cela est possible.

at0014.1.description: Une description supplémentaire de l'enregistrement de la profession qui n'a pas été saisie dans d'autres champs.

at0005.1.description: Le titre principal de l'emploi ou le rôle de l'individu.
at0005.1.comment: Par exemple : Directeur général, soignant ou étudiant. Chacun de ces titres ou rôles peut comporter plusieurs fonctions.

at0016.1.description: Description de l'emploi ou du la fonction exercé par la personne.

at0006.1.description: Le type d'emploi occupé par l'individu.
at0006.1.comment: Il est souhaitable d'utiliser, dans la mesure du possible, une terminologie telle que la CITP-08. Par exemple : Directeur des ventes ou ingénieur en logiciel.

at0007.1.description: La date à laquelle l'individu a commencé l'emploi ou la fonction.

at0008.1.description: La date à laquelle une personne a cessé de travailler dans un emploi ou une fonction.

at0019.1.description: Le temps alloué à une personne pour exercer l'emploi ou la fonction par période spécifiée dans cette fiche de profession.
at0019.1.comment: Par exemple : "3 jours par semaine", "10 jours par mois" ou "2 heures par jour".

at0000.1.description: Un travail ou un rôle unique exercé par un individu pendant une période de temps déterminée.

at0001.1.description: Le statut d'un travailleur en termes de rémunération ou d'absence de rémunération.
at0001.1.comment: Par exemple : non rémunéré, rémunéré, indépendant ou bénévole. Il est souhaitable de coder avec une terminologie, lorsque cela est possible.

at0000.description: Um único trabalho ou função desempenhada por um indivíduo durante um período de tempo especificado.

at0001.description: O status de um trabalhador em termos de ser pago ou não.
at0001.comment: Por exemplo: não remunerado; remunerado; trabalhadores por conta própria; ou voluntário. É desejável codificar com uma terminologia, sempre que possível.

at0002.description: O tipo de indústria em que o indivíduo trabalha.
at0002.comment: Por exemplo: Mineração, fabricação, construção. É desejável codificar com uma terminologia, sempre que possível.

at0004.description: Detalhes sobre o empregador ou instituição.

at0005.description: O cargo principal ou a função do indivíduo.
at0005.comment: Por exemplo: CEO; Cuidador; ou aluno. Cada um desses cargos ou funções pode ser composto de várias ocupações.

at0006.description: O tipo de trabalho realizado pelo indivíduo.
at0006.comment:
É desejável codificar com uma terminologia, sempre que possível, como o ISCO-08.
Por exemplo: Gerente de vendas ou engenheiro de software.

at0007.description: A data em que um indivíduo iniciou o trabalho ou função.

at0008.description: A data em que um indivíduo deixou de trabalhar em um emprego ou função.

at0013.description: O tempo gasto nesse trabalho ou função em relação ao período integral.
at0013.comment: O equivalente a tempo integral também pode ser conhecido como 'ETI'. Por exemplo: 0,5; 50%; ou "tempo parcial".

at0014.description: Narrativa adicional sobre o registro de ocupação não registrada em outros campos.

at0016.description: Descrição narrativa sobre o trabalho ou função desempenhada pelo indivíduo.

at0018.description: Mais detalhes sobre um registro de ocupação.
at0018.comment: Por exemplo: local e condições do local de trabalho; ou experiência na zona de combate.

at0019.description: A quantidade de tempo que um indivíduo é alocado para realizar o trabalho ou função por período especificado desse registro de ocupação.
at0019.comment: Por exemplo: '3 dias por semana', '10 dias por mês' ou '2 horas por dia'.

at0020.description: O indivíduo realiza essa ocupação por igual ou superior quantidade de tempo que é oficialmente considerada como 'período integral' para a ocupação.

at0021.description: O indivíduo realiza essa ocupação por menos do que o tempo considerado oficialmente como 'período integral' para a ocupação.

at0013.1.description: O tempo gasto nesse trabalho ou função em relação ao período integral.
at0013.1.comment: O equivalente a tempo integral também pode ser conhecido como 'ETI'. Por exemplo: 0,5; 50%; ou "tempo parcial".

at0002.1.description: O tipo de indústria em que o indivíduo trabalha.
at0002.1.comment: Por exemplo: Mineração, fabricação, construção. É desejável codificar com uma terminologia, sempre que possível.

at0014.1.description: Narrativa adicional sobre o registro de ocupação não registrada em outros campos.

at0005.1.description: O cargo principal ou a função do indivíduo.
at0005.1.comment: Por exemplo: CEO; Cuidador; ou aluno. Cada um desses cargos ou funções pode ser composto de várias ocupações.

at0016.1.description: Descrição narrativa sobre o trabalho ou função desempenhada pelo indivíduo.

at0006.1.description: O tipo de trabalho realizado pelo indivíduo.
at0006.1.comment:
É desejável codificar com uma terminologia, sempre que possível, como o ISCO-08.
Por exemplo: Gerente de vendas ou engenheiro de software.

nb.purpose: For å registrere informasjon om en sykemelding til en person.
nb.use: Bruk for å registrere informasjon om en sykemelding til en person.

en.purpose: To record information about a sick note of an individual.
en.use:
Use to record details about a sick note of an individual, including start and end date.

This archetype has been designed to allow to mark start- and eventually end date when an individual has a medical condition where there are indications of temporal leave from their job. It is intended to be inserted in the Additional details SLOT in CLUSTER.occupation._record or OBSERVATION.occupation_summary, or other archetypes where clinically relevant. An ongoing sickness leave can be assumed if there is a start date and no end date.

It the individuals possess multiple jobs, and it is needed to differentiate a graded sickness leave between them, use a separate instance of this archetype for each job.
en.misuse: Not to be used to make a medical certificate to authorities to underpin sickness benefit. Use appropriate ADMIN Entry archetypes for this purpose.

nb.purpose: For å registrere et individs arbeidsstatus i forbindelse med prosjektet Strukturert Kreftjournal.
nb.use:
Brukes for å registrere et individs arbeidsstatus i forbindelse med prosjektet Strukturert kreftjournal.

Verdisettet for dataelementet "Arbeidsstatus" er standardisert basert på krav utarbeidet av Helsedirektoratet. 

Dette templatet vil bli brukt i prosjektet Strukturert Kreftjournal under sosialanamnese.

Småtemplatet med det standardiserte verdisettet kan benyttes utenfor Strukturert kreftjournal hvor det lagres data om arbeidsstatus.

Verdisettet med tilhørende forklaring i dette templatet for arbeidsstatus er:
- I arbeid = Alle som har jobb og identifiserer seg med at deres hovedkategori er å være i arbeid. Både fulltid og deltid.
- Ikke i arbeid = Alle som ikke har et arbeidsforhold: hjemmeværende, permitterte, arbeidssøkende, uføretrygdet, under rehabilitering, under attføring eller arbeidsmarkedskurs o.l., samt avtjener verneplikt, siviltjeneste. De med et arbeidsforhold, men som er midlertidig sykemeldt ansees for å være i arbeid.
- Alderspensjonist = Ikke uførepensjon eller andre pensjonsformer annet enn aldersrelatert. AFP er inkludert.
- Under utdanning/studerer = Innrullert i et studieløp og identifiserer seg som hovedsakelig student/elev. Både fulltid og deltid.
- Ukjent = Ukjent arbeidsstatus.

nb.purpose: For å registrere et individs utdanningsnivå i forbindelse med prosjektet Strukturert Kreftjournal.
nb.use:
Brukes for å registrere et individs utdanningsnivå i forbindelse med prosjektet Strukturert Kreftjournal. 

Verdisettet for dataelementet "Høyeste fullførte utdanningsnivå" er standardisert basert på krav utarbeidet av Helsedirektoratet.
 
Dette templatet vil bli brukt i prosjektet Strukturert Kreftjournal under sosialanamnese.

Småtemplatet med det standardiserte verdisettet kan benyttes utenfor Strukturert kreftjournal hvor det lagres data om arbeidsstatus.

Verdisettet med tilhørende forklaring i dette templatet for utdanningsnivå er:
- Ingen utdanning = Ingen skolegang.
- Grunnskole = Grunnskole 7-10 år, framhaldsskole eller folkehøyskole.
- Videregående = Inkluderer VGS I og VGS II, allmenn/ studiespesialisering. Yrkesfaglig, påbygning.
- Universitet/Høyskole <4 år = Mindre enn 4 år.
- Universitet/Høyskole ≥4 år = 4 år eller mer. Inkl. forskerutdanning.
- Ukjent = Utdanningsnivået er ukjent.

at0000.description: Summary or persistent information about an individual's current and past education or training.

at0002.description: Description of highest category of education or training completed.
at0002.comment: Coding with a terminology is desirable, where possible. For example: the ISCED classification, such as upper secondary vocational education; post-secondary non-tertiary vocational education; Bachelor’s or equivalent level, professional; Doctoral or equivalent level, academic; post-secondary non-tertiary vocational education; or never attended an educational program.

at0003.description: Age when an individual first commenced formal education.
at0003.comment: In the context of this archetype, formal education includes all education that is based on a structured curriculum and delivered by trained professionals.

Sistnevnte forefinnes ikke på norsk, men eksempel er "'Upper secondary vocational education"; "Post-secondary non-tertiary vocational education"; "Bachelor’s or equivalent level, professional"; "Doctoral or equivalent level, academic"; "Post-secondary non-tertiary vocational education"; or "Never attended an educational program".

de.purpose: Zur Darstellung zusammenfassender Informationen über den Alkoholkonsum einer Person.
de.use:
Zur Darstellung zusammenfassender Informationen über das typische Muster des Alkoholkonsums einer Person.

Dieser Archetyp soll verwendet werden, um Informationen über das aktuelle und frühere Alkoholkonsumverhalten aufzuzeichnen.

Der spezifische Anwendungsbereich dieses Archetyps liegt in der Dokumentation sämtlicher Arten von Alkohol, die von einer Person konsumiert oder anderweitig eingenommen werden, aufgrund der damit verbundenen Gesundheitsrisiken.

Die Entwicklung der Zu- und Abnahme des Konsums jeglicher Art von Alkohol im Laufe der Zeit kann mit dem wiederholbaren Cluster "Pro Episode" festgehalten werden. 

Die Auslöser für das Beenden einer Episode und den Beginn einer neuen Episode sind weitgehend abhängig von lokalen Präferenzen bei der Datenerfassung, einschließlich ob die Person:: 
- für einen signifikanten Zeitraum (der wahrscheinlich lokal definiert wird) aufhört zu trinken; oder
- die Menge oder das Muster ihres Alkoholkonsums signifikant verändert.

Das Cluster 'Pro Typ' ermöglicht die Aufzeichnung spezifischer Details und Episoden jeder Art von konsumierten alkoholischen Getränken und kann einmal pro Typ wiederholt werden. Das Element 'Typ' kennzeichnet die Art des Alkohols, entweder als Freitext oder als codierter Text mit einem definierten Wertesatz.

In manchen Situationen konsumiert der Einzelne nur eine Art von alkoholischen Getränken, wie z.B. Bier. Wenn andere Arten von alkoholischen Getränken verwendet werden, werden die Details in einer anderen Instanz des Clusters "Pro Typ" aufgezeichnet.

Zu verwenden, um die Beschreibungen von Alkoholkonsumgewohnheiten innerhalb bestehender oder älterer klinischer Systeme in ein archetypisches Format zu integrieren, unter Verwendung des Datenelements "Gesamtbeschreibung".
de.misuse:
Nicht zur Darstellung ereignis- oder periodenbezogener Informationen über den Alkoholkonsum, wie z.B. den tatsächlichen täglichen Konsum oder den durchschnittlichen Konsum über einen bestimmten Zeitraum geeignet - verwenden Sie hierzu den Archetyp OBSERVATION.alcohol_intake.

Nicht zur Darstellung einer Beurteilung der Alkoholabhängigkeit verwenden. Verwenden Sie zu diesem Zweck bestimmte Archetypen - zum Beispiel OBSERVATION.audit.

Nicht zur Darstellung der Verabreichung von Alkohol auf anderen Wegen, wie z.B. beim Einatmen, verwenden.

sv.purpose: Att registrera information om individens alkoholvanor
sv.use:
Används för att beskriva sammanfattad information om individens alkohol konsumtion

Den här arketypen kan användas för att registrera information om både nuvarande och tidigare alkoholanvändning.

Det specifika fokuset för denna arketyp är på dokumentation om användningen av alla typer av alkoholkonsumtion relaterad till hälsorisker.

Historiken om ökad och minskad konsumtion för varje typ av alkoholhaltig dryck över tiden kan fångas med hjälp av det repeterbara "Per episod" -klustret.

Anledningar för att stänga en episod och starta en ny kommer i hög grad att återspegla lokala datainsamlingspreferenser, inklusive om individen:
- slutar dricka under en speciell tidsperiod (vilket sannolikt kommer att vara lokalt definierat) eller
- signifikant ändrar användningsgrad eller mönster för sin alkoholkonsumtion.

"Per typ"-klustret av dataelement gör det möjligt att registrera specifika detaljer om varje typ av alkoholhaltig dryck som konsumeras och kan upprepas för varje typ av alkoholhaltig dryck som konsumeras i själva episoden. Elementet 'Typ' identifierar typen av alkohol, antingen som en fri text eller kodad text med en definierad värde.

I vissa situationer kommer individen bara att konsumera en typ av alkoholhaltig dryck, till exempel öl. Om andra typer av alkoholhaltiga drycker används kommer detaljerna att registreras i en annan instans av klustret "Per typ".

För att införliva beskrivande information om alkoholvanor från befintliga eller gamla vård-IT-system till ett arketyp-baserade system använd dataelementet "Övergripande beskrivning".
sv.misuse:
Används inte för att registrera händelse- eller periodbaserad information om alkoholanvändning, till exempel faktisk daglig användning eller genomsnittlig användning under en viss tidsperiod - använd då OBSERVATION.alcohol_intake-arketypen

Att inte användas för att registrera en bedömning om alkoholberoende. Använd specifika arketyper för detta ändamål.

Används inte för att registrera alkoholkonsumtion vid andra vägar, såsom inandning.

nb.purpose: For å registrere sammendrag eller detaljer om et individs tidligere og nåværende bruk av alkohol.
nb.use:
Brukes for å registrere sammendrag eller detaljer om et individs tidligere og nåværende bruk av alkohol.

Denne arketypen er tenkt brukt til å registrere informasjon om både nåværende og tidligere bruk av alkohol.

Rammen for denne arketypen er å dokumentere alle typer alkoholinntak, fordi konsum av alkohol er forbundet med helserisiko.

Historikken knyttet til økt eller redusert bruk av hver type alkoholholdig drikk over tid kan registreres ved å bruke clusteret 'Per episode'. Clusteret kan repeteres. Denne samlingen dataelementer tillater detaljert registrering av alkoholrelatert atferd per type alkoholholdig drikk, for eksempel dersom individet drikker øl hver dag, vin hver fredag og sprit av og til på fest.

Avgjørelsen om når én episode avslutter og en ny episode starter, skal reflektere de lokale preferansene for datainnsamling, for eksempel dersom individet:
- slutter i en periode av signifikant varighet (hva som er 'signifikant varighet' vil mest sannsynlig være definert lokalt), eller
- gjør en signifikant endring i inntaksmengden av, eller mønsteret i sin alkoholbruk.

Clusteret 'Per type' tillater registrering av spesifikke detaljer knyttet til ulike typer alkoholholdig drikke. Clusteret kan repeteres for hver type alkoholholdig drikke som konsumeres. Typen alkoholholdig drikke identifiseres i elementet "Type" og man kan velge å angi dette som enten fritekst, eller fra verdisettet som er definert som kodet tekst.

I noen tilfeller vil individet konsumere kun én type alkohol, som for eksempel øl. Inntas også andre typer alkoholholdig drikke, legges detaljene i en ny instans av clusteret 'Per type'.

Dataelementet 'Overordnet beskrivelse' brukes til å gi fritekstbeskrivelser av alkoholbruk, eller til å overføre data fra eksisterende eller tidligere kliniske systemer til arketypeformat.
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke til registrering av hendelses- eller periodebasert informasjon om drikking av alkohol, som faktisk daglig bruk eller gjennomsnittlig bruk over en gitt periode, som siste 30 dager - bruk arketypen OBSERVATION.alcohol_intake til dette.

Brukes ikke til registrering av vurdering av alkoholavhengighet. Bruk spesifikke arketyper til dette formålet, for eksempel OBSERVATION.audit.

Brukes ikke til registrering av andre måter å innta alkohol på enn drikking, som for eksempel inhalasjon.

en.purpose: To record summary information about the individual's typical pattern of alcohol consumption.
en.use:
Use to record summary information about the individual's typical pattern of alcohol consumption.

This archetype is to be used to record information about both current and previous alcohol consumption.

The specific scope of this archetype is about documentation about all types of alcohol consumed or ingested by an individual, because of the associated health risks.

The history of waxing and waning of consumption for each type of alcohol over time can be captured using the repeatable 'Per episode' cluster. 

Triggers for closing one episode and commencing a new one will largely reflect local data collection preferences, including if the individual: 
- quits for a significant period of time (which will likely be locally defined); or
- significantly changes the amount or the pattern of alcohol consumption.

The 'Per type' cluster of data elements allows for recording of specific details about each type of alcohol consumed, and can be repeated for every type alcoholic beverage consumed in the actual episode.  The element 'Type' identifies the type of alcohol, either as a free text or coded text with a defined valueset.

In many situations the individual will only consume one type of alcohol, such as beer. If other types of alcohol are consumed, the details will be recorded in another instance of the 'Per type' cluster.

Use to incorporate the narrative descriptions of alcohol consumption within existing or legacy clinical systems into an archetyped format, using the 'Overall description' data element.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record event-or period-based information about alcohol drinking, such as actual daily drinking/binging or the average drinking over a specified period of time - use the OBSERVATION.alcohol_intake archetype.

Not to be used to record an assessment about alcohol dependence. Use specific archetypes for this purpose - for example OBSERVATION.audit.

Not to be used to record administration of alcohol by other routes, such as inhalation.

nl.purpose: Om samenvattende informatie over het typische alcohol consumptie patroon van een individu vast te leggen.
nl.use:
Gebruik om samenvattende informatie over het typische alcohol consumptie patroon van een individu vast te leggen.

Dit archetype dient gebruikt te worden voor zowel huidige als voormalig alcohol consumptie.

De specifieke scope van dit archetype is het vastleggen van alle typen alcohol geconsumeerd of ingenomen door een individu, in verband met de geassocieerde gezondheidsrisico's.

De geschiedenis van het toenemen en afnemen van gebruik van ieder type alcohol door de tijd heen kan vastgelegd worden doormiddel van het herhaalbare 'Per episode' cluster.

Redenen om een episode te sluiten en een nieuwe te starten hangen af van de lokale voorkeuren, indien het individu:
- gestopt is voor een significante periode (de definitie waarvan waarschijnlijk lokaal gedefinieerd zal zijn); of
- significant verandert in de hoeveelheid of het patroon van alcohol consumptie.

Het 'Per type' cluster van data elementen staat het vastleggen van specifieke details over consumptie van ieder type alcohol toe. Dit kan herhaald worden voor ieder type alcoholische drank genuttigd in de episode. Het element 'Type' identificeert het type alcohol, als een vrij textveld of een gecodeerde text met een voorgedefinieerde waardenset.

In veel situaties zal het individu maar één type alcohol consumeren, zoals bier. Indien andere types alcohol geconsumeerd worden kunnen deze details vastgelegd worden in aanvullende 'Per type' clusters.

Gebruik om een verhalende beschrijving van alcoholgebruik vast te leggen binnen bestaande of legacy klinische systemen in een archetyped formaat het 'Algemene beschrijving' data element.
nl.misuse:
Niet te gebruiken om gebeurtenissen of periode-gebasserde informatie over alcoholgebruik vast te leggen, zoals bijvoorbeeld de daadwerkelijke dagelijkse / overmatige / gemiddelde consumptie over een bepaalde periode. Gebruik hiervoor het OBSERVATION.alcohol_intake archetype.

Niet te gebruiken om een beoordeling van afhankelijkheid van alcohol vast te leggen. Gebruik hiervoor specifieke archetypes zoals OBSERVATION.audit.

Niet te gebruiken voor het vastleggen van toediening van alcohol op andere wijzen, zoals inhaleren.

at0000.1.description: Summary or persistent information about the typical alcohol consumption of an individual.

at0000.description: Summary or persistent information about the typical alcohol consumption of an individual.

at0003.description: Individual is a current consumer of alcohol.

at0005.description: Individual has previously consumed alcohol but is not a current drinker.

at0006.description: Individual has never consumed alcohol.

at0013.description: Date when this episode commenced.
at0013.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year.

at0014.description: Date when the individual last consumed alcohol.
at0014.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year. Definitions for a 'Quit date' vary enormously and can be defined using the 'Quit data definition' data element in the Protocol section of this archetype. This date will be identical to the 'Episode end date' for the most recent episode. This date could be used by decision support guidance to determine if the individual is at risk of relapse, for example in the first 12 months since quitting.

at0015.description: The date or partial date when the individual first started frequent or regular, but usually non-daily, consumption of alcohol.
at0015.comment: This data element is recording when a regular pattern of drinking commenced, rather than the first ever taste of alcohol. The first taste could be at a very young age and then no drinking until mid teens. In this case it is the pattern in the mid teens that is clinically significant. To differentiate between patterns of drinking, that has to be recorded in other elements in this archetype, for example in the 'Per episode' section.

at0016.description: The date when the individual last ceased consuming alcohol of any type.
at0016.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year. This date could be used by decision support guidance to determine if the individual is at risk of relapse, for example in the first 12 months since quitting.

at0019.description: Additional narrative about all alcohol consumption that has not been captured in other fields.

at0021.description: @ internal @

at0022.description: The date this alcohol consumption summary was last updated.

at0023.description: Estimate of number of alcohol units consumed.

at0025.description: Total number of times the individual has attempted to stop consuming alcohol within this episode.

at0026.description: Additional structured details about the specified episode of alcohol consumption.

at0029.description: Details about consumption of a specified type of alcohol.

at0030.description: The typical pattern of consumption of alcohol.
at0030.comment: The typical pattern of use can be made more granular by coding with a terminology or a local value set in a template.

at0043.description: Narrative summary about the individual's overall alcohol consumption pattern and history.
at0043.comment: Use this data element to record a narrative description of alcohol drinking habits for this individual or to incorporate unstructured alcohol drinking information from existing or legacy clinical systems into an archetyped format.

at0052.description: Statement about current alcohol drinking behaviour.

at0053.description: Narrative summary about alcohol consumption for the specified type of alcohol.

at0061.description: Individual consumed alcohol during this period.

at0064.description: Details about a discrete period of time with a consistent pattern of typical consumption.

at0069.description: Additional narrative about consumption of the specified type of alcohol, not captured in other fields.

at0071.description: The applied definition for the 'Quit date' data elements used in this archetype.

at0073.description: Additional information required to capture local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
at0073.comment: For example: local information requirements or additional metadata to align with FHIR or CIMI equivalents.

at0075.description: The applied definition for the 'Current drinker' value in each of the 'Status' data elements used in this archetype.

at0076.description: The applied definition for the 'Former drinker' value in each of the 'Status' data elements used in this archetype.

at0077.description: Additional structured details about the consumption of the specified alcohol.

at0079.description: The applied definition for the 'Lifetime non-drinker' value in each of the 'Status' data elements used in this archetype.

at0080.description: The date or partial date when the individual first started consuming alcohol on a daily basis.
at0080.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year.

at0081.description: Identification of an episode of alcohol consumption - either as a number in a sequence and/or a named event.
at0081.comment: For example: '2' as the second episode within a sequence of episodes; 'Life-long'; or 'Pregnancy with twins' if describing the alcohol consumption during a health event such as during a specific pregnancy.

at0082.description: Date when this episode ceased.
at0082.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year. This data field will be empty if the episode is current and ongoing.

at0083.description: Consuming alcoholic beverage at least once every day.

at0084.description: Not consuming alcoholic beverage every day.

at0085.description: The applied definition for a Quit attempt used to determine value for the 'Number of quit attempts' data element used in this archetype.
at0085.comment: For example: 'stopped consuming alcohol for one day or longer with the intention of quitting'.

at0086.description: Additional structured details about the overall alcohol consumption.

at0087.description: Additional narrative about alcohol consumption during the specified episode, not captured in other fields.
at0087.comment: For example: alcohol consumed as a hangover remedy eg 'hair of the dog'.

at0089.description: Statement about current consumption for all types of alcohol.

at0091.description: Individual has not consumed alcohol during this episode.

at0097.description: The individual's typical frequency of heavy drinking over a short period of time with the intent of becoming intoxicated.

at0104.description: Mass of alcohol defining a standard drink or alcohol unit as used in the 'Typical drinking (alcohol units)' element in this archetype.

at0108.description: The name of the specific type or grouping of alcohol.
at0108.comment: Use of the coded text option is preferrable when possible. Alternatively, it's possible to use a local valueset or terminologi to record specific types of alcoholic beverages. For example: red or white wine; brandy or whisky; normal or low alcohol beer; or denatured alcohol (methylated spirits) as a specific form of rectified spirits.

at0110.description: The number of days where no alcohol was consumed in the specified period.

at0111.description: Estimate of number of standard drinks of the specified type of alcohol consumed.
at0111.comment: The definition of an Alcohol unit can be recorded in the Protocol.

at0112.description: Narrative summary about the individual's overall pattern of alcohol consumption during the specified episode.
at0112.comment: For example: details about binge drinking pattern.

at0113.description: Narrative description about the individual's typical pattern of binge drinking.

at0114.description: The date or partial date when the individual became intoxicated for the first time.
at0114.comment: This data point is not intended to record an accidental intoxication but to identify when a behaviour pattern of harmful consumption may have commenced.

at0115.description: Fermented beverage made from grain mash.

at0116.description: Fermented beverage made from grapes and sometimes other fruits.

at0117.description: Fermented beverage made from any fruit juice.

at0118.description: Fermented beverage made from honey, sometimes with various fruits spices, grains or hops.

at0119.description: Fermented beverage made from 'honey water" of cacti.

at0120.description: Fermented beverage made by a distillation process. Usually has an alcohol content >20%. Includes liquers, cocktails and rectified spirits.

at0110.1.description: The number of days where no alcohol was consumed in the specified period.

at0114.1.description: The date or partial date when the individual became intoxicated for the first time.
at0114.1.comment: This data point is not intended to record an accidental intoxication but to identify when a behaviour pattern of harmful consumption may have commenced.

at0112.1.description: Narrative summary about the individual's overall pattern of alcohol consumption during the specified episode.
at0112.1.comment: For example: details about binge drinking pattern.

at0113.1.description: Narrative description about the individual's typical pattern of binge drinking.

at0013.1.description: Date when this episode commenced.
at0013.1.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year.

at0014.1.description: Date when the individual last consumed alcohol.
at0014.1.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year. Definitions for a 'Quit date' vary enormously and can be defined using the 'Quit data definition' data element in the Protocol section of this archetype. This date will be identical to the 'Episode end date' for the most recent episode. This date could be used by decision support guidance to determine if the individual is at risk of relapse, for example in the first 12 months since quitting.

at0015.1.description: The date or partial date when the individual first started frequent or regular, but usually non-daily, consumption of alcohol.
at0015.1.comment: This data element is recording when a regular pattern of drinking commenced, rather than the first ever taste of alcohol. The first taste could be at a very young age and then no drinking until mid teens. In this case it is the pattern in the mid teens that is clinically significant. To differentiate between patterns of drinking, that has to be recorded in other elements in this archetype, for example in the 'Per episode' section.

at0016.1.description: The date when the individual last ceased consuming alcohol of any type.
at0016.1.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year. This date could be used by decision support guidance to determine if the individual is at risk of relapse, for example in the first 12 months since quitting.

at0079.1.description: The applied definition for the 'Lifetime non-drinker' value in each of the 'Status' data elements used in this archetype.

at0019.1.description: Additional narrative about all alcohol consumption that has not been captured in other fields.

at0097.1.description: The individual's typical frequency of heavy drinking over a short period of time with the intent of becoming intoxicated.

at0052.1.description: Statement about current alcohol drinking behaviour.

at0030.1.description: The typical pattern of consumption of alcohol.
at0030.1.comment: The typical pattern of use can be made more granular by coding with a terminology or a local value set in a template.

at0071.1.description: The applied definition for the 'Quit date' data elements used in this archetype.

at0076.1.description: The applied definition for the 'Former drinker' value in each of the 'Status' data elements used in this archetype.

at0075.1.description: The applied definition for the 'Current drinker' value in each of the 'Status' data elements used in this archetype.

at0080.1.description: The date or partial date when the individual first started consuming alcohol on a daily basis.
at0080.1.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year.

at0081.1.description: Identification of an episode of alcohol consumption - either as a number in a sequence and/or a named event.
at0081.1.comment: For example: '2' as the second episode within a sequence of episodes; 'Life-long'; or 'Pregnancy with twins' if describing the alcohol consumption during a health event such as during a specific pregnancy.

at0104.1.description: Mass of alcohol defining a standard drink or alcohol unit as used in the 'Typical drinking (alcohol units)' element in this archetype.

at0025.1.description: Total number of times the individual has attempted to stop consuming alcohol within this episode.

at0029.1.description: Details about consumption of a specified type of alcohol.

at0087.1.description: Additional narrative about alcohol consumption during the specified episode, not captured in other fields.
at0087.1.comment: For example: alcohol consumed as a hangover remedy eg 'hair of the dog'.

at0089.1.description: Statement about current consumption for all types of alcohol.

at0082.1.comment: Can be a partial date, for example, only a year. This data field will be empty if the episode is current and ongoing.

at0023.1.description: Estimate of number of alcohol units consumed.

at0043.1.description: Narrative summary about the individual's overall alcohol consumption pattern and history.
at0043.1.comment: Use this data element to record a narrative description of alcohol drinking habits for this individual or to incorporate unstructured alcohol drinking information from existing or legacy clinical systems into an archetyped format.

at0064.1.description: Details about a discrete period of time with a consistent pattern of typical consumption.

at0085.1.description: The applied definition for a Quit attempt used to determine value for the 'Number of quit attempts' data element used in this archetype.
at0085.1.comment: For example: 'stopped consuming alcohol for one day or longer with the intention of quitting'.

at0000.1.description: Sammendrag eller detaljer om et individs tidligere og nåværende bruk av alkohol.

at0043.1.description: Oppsummering i fritekst om et individs overordnede mønster og historie knyttet til alkoholinntak.
at0043.1.comment: Bruk dette elementet for å registrere en beskrivelse i fritekst om drikkevaner for dette individet.

at0000.description: Sammendrag eller detaljer om et individs tidligere og nåværende bruk av alkohol.

at0003.description: Individet drikker alkohol.

at0005.description: Individet har drukket alkohol tidligere, men drikker ikke nå.

at0006.description: Individet har aldri drukket alkohol.

at0013.description: Dato da episoden startet.
at0013.comment: Kan være en deldato, for eksempel kun årstall.

at0014.description: Datoen da individet sluttet å drikke alkohol.
at0014.comment: Kan være en deldato, for eksempel årstall. Definisjoner for "Sluttdato" varierer enormt og kan defineres ved å bruke dataelementet "Definisjon på Sluttdato" i protokolldelen av denne arketypen. Denne datoen vil være identisk med "Episodens sluttdato" for den siste episoden. Denne datoen kan brukes av beslutningsstøttesystemer for å beregne om individet er i faresonen for tilbakefall, for eksempel i løpet av de første 12 månedene etter å ha sluttet.

at0015.description: Dato eller deldato da individet for første gang begynte å bruke alkohol hyppig eller regelmessig, men ikke daglig.
at0015.comment: Kan være en deldato, for eksempel kun årstall. Dette elementet brukes for når et individ begynte å drikke alkohol regelmessig, heller enn første gang individet smakte alkohol. Den første smaken kunne være på et veldig tidlig tidspunkt i livet, og så kan individet ha et opphold til midten av tenårene før det begynte å konsumere alkohol. Dersom det er tilfelle, er det mønsteret som startet i midten av tenårene som er klinisk relevant. For å skille mellom drikkemønster gjennom livet, må man bruke andre elementer i denne arketypen, for eksempel i clusteret "Per episode".

at0016.description: Datoen da individet sist brukte en hvilken som helst type alkohol.
at0016.comment: Kan være en deldato, for eksempel årstall. Denne datoen kan brukes av beslutningsstøttesystemer for å beregne om individet er i faresonen for tilbakefall, for eksempel i løpet av de første 12 månedene etter å ha sluttet.

at0019.description: Ytterligere fritekst om all bruk av alkohol, og som ikke er fanget i andre element.

at0023.description: Estimat på antall alkoholenheter som ble drukket.

at0025.description: Totalt antall ganger individet har forsøkt å slutte å drikke alkohol i denne episoden.

Alternativt kan man bruke et lokalt verdisett eller en terminologi for å registrere spesifikke type alkoholholdige drikker, for eksempel rød eller hvit vin, brandy eller whisky, vanlig øl eller lettøl, eller denaturert alkohol som rødsprit som en spesifikk type sprit.

at0003.description: Individen är konsument av alkohol

at0005.description: Individen har tidigare konsumerat alkohol men har slutat.

at0006.description: Individen har aldrig konsumerat alkohol

at0013.description: Datum när den här episoden startade.
at0013.comment: Kan vara del av ett datum, till exempel bara ett år.

at0014.description: *Date when the individual last consumed alcohol. (en)
at0014.comment: Kan vara del av ett datum, till exempel bara ett år. Definitioner för ett "Slutdatum" varierar enormt och kan definieras med dataelementet "Avsluta data definition" i protokolldelen i den här arketypen. Detta datum kommer att vara identiskt med "Episodslutdatum" för den senaste episoden. Detta datum kan användas av beslutsstödsguiden för att avgöra om individen är i riskzonen för återfall, till exempel under de första 12 månaderna sedan hen slutade.

at0015.description: Datum eller del av datum när individen först började att konsumera alkohol frekvent eller regelbundet, men inte dagligen.
at0015.comment: Detta dataelement registreras när ett vanligt förbrukningsmönster började, snarare än den första smaken av alkohol. Den första smaken kan vara i mycket ung ålder och då ingen dricka till mitten av tonåren. I detta fall är det mönstret i mitten av tonåren som är kliniskt signifikant. För att skilja mellan konsumtionsmönster, måste det registreras i andra delar i den här arketypen, till exempel i avsnittet 'Per episod'.

at0016.description: Datum då individen helt slutade använda alkohol, oavsett typ.
at0016.comment: Kan vara ett del av datum, till exempel bara ett årtal. Detta datum kan användas av för att avgöra om individen är i riskzonen för återfall, till exempel under de första 12 månaderna sedan hen slutade.

at0019.description: Ytterligare beskrivande information om all alkoholanvändning som inte har fångats i andra fält.

at0013.1.description: Datum när den här episoden startade.
at0013.1.comment: Kan vara del av ett datum, till exempel bara ett år.

at0014.1.description: *Date when the individual last consumed alcohol. (en)
at0014.1.comment: Kan vara del av ett datum, till exempel bara ett år. Definitioner för ett "Slutdatum" varierar enormt och kan definieras med dataelementet "Avsluta data definition" i protokolldelen i den här arketypen. Detta datum kommer att vara identiskt med "Episodslutdatum" för den senaste episoden. Detta datum kan användas av beslutsstödsguiden för att avgöra om individen är i riskzonen för återfall, till exempel under de första 12 månaderna sedan hen slutade.

at0015.1.description: Datum eller del av datum när individen först började att konsumera alkohol frekvent eller regelbundet, men inte dagligen.
at0015.1.comment: Detta dataelement registreras när ett vanligt förbrukningsmönster började, snarare än den första smaken av alkohol. Den första smaken kan vara i mycket ung ålder och då ingen dricka till mitten av tonåren. I detta fall är det mönstret i mitten av tonåren som är kliniskt signifikant. För att skilja mellan konsumtionsmönster, måste det registreras i andra delar i den här arketypen, till exempel i avsnittet 'Per episod'.

at0016.1.description: Datum då individen helt slutade använda alkohol, oavsett typ.
at0016.1.comment: Kan vara ett del av datum, till exempel bara ett årtal. Detta datum kan användas av för att avgöra om individen är i riskzonen för återfall, till exempel under de första 12 månaderna sedan hen slutade.

at0000.description: Zusammenfassende oder fortdauernde Informationen über den typischen Alkoholkonsum einer Person.

at0003.description: Die Person ist aktuell Alkoholkonsument.

at0005.description: Die Person hat früher Alkohol konsumiert, ist aber aktuell kein Alkoholkonsument.

at0006.description: Die Person hat niemals Alkohol konsumiert.

at0013.description: Datum, an dem die Episode begann.
at0013.comment: Kann ein Teildatum sein, z.B. ein Jahr.

at0014.description: *Date when the individual last consumed alcohol. (en)
at0014.comment: Kann ein Teildatum sein, z.B. nur ein Jahr. Die Definitionen für ein 'Allgemeiner Zeitpunkt des Aufhörens' sind sehr unterschiedlich und können über das Datenelement 'Definition des Aufhörens' im Protokollbereich dieses Archetyps definiert werden. Dieses Datum ist identisch mit dem Enddatum der Episode für die letzte Episode. Dieses Datum könnte von der Entscheidungsunterstützung genutzt werden, um festzustellen, ob die Person, zum Beispiel in den ersten 12 Monaten nach dem Aufhören, einem Rückfallrisiko ausgesetzt ist.

at0015.description: Das Datum oder Teildatum, an dem die Person zum ersten Mal mit einem häufigen oder regelmäßigen, aber in der Regel nicht täglichen Alkoholkonsum begann.
at0015.comment: Dieses Datenelement zeichnet auf, wenn ein regelmäßiges Trinkverhalten einsetzte, und nicht der erste Alkoholkonsum überhaupt. Der erste Konsum könnte in einem sehr jungen Alter sein und dann kein Konsum bis zum mittleren Teenageralter. In diesem Fall ist das Muster in den mittleren Teenagerjahren klinisch signifikant. Um zwischen Trinkmustern zu unterscheiden, die in anderen Elementen dieses Archetyps aufgezeichnet werden müssen, z.B. im Abschnitt "Pro Episode".

at0016.description: Das Datum, an dem die Person zuletzt den Konsum von Alkohol jeglicher Art eingestellt hat.
at0016.comment: Ein Teildatum kann z.B. nur ein Jahr sein. Dieses Datum könnte als Entscheidungshilfe verwendet werden, um festzustellen, ob die Person rückfallgefährdet ist, z.B. in den ersten 12 Monaten nach dem Aufhören.

at0019.description: Zusätzliche Informationen über den Konsum des angegebenen alkoholischen Getränks, die nicht in anderen Feldern erfasst wurde.

at0108.comment: Die Verwendung der Option "CodedText" ist nach Möglichkeit vorzuziehen. Alternativ ist es möglich, mit einem lokalen Valueset oder einer Terminologie bestimmte Arten von alkoholischen Getränken zu erfassen. Zum Beispiel: Rot- oder Weißwein; Brandy oder Whisky; normales oder alkoholreduziertes Bier; oder denaturierter Alkohol (methylierter Alkohol) als eine bestimmte Form von rektifiziertem Alkohol.

at0087.1.description: Zusätzliche Kommentare über den Alkoholkonsum während der angegebenen Episode, die nicht in anderen Feldern erfasst wurde.
at0087.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: Alkohol, der als Katermittel konsumiert wird, z.B. "Konterbier".

at0089.1.description: Information zum aktuellen Alkoholkonsumverhalten für alle Arten von Alkohol.

at0082.1.description: Datum, an dem die Episode endete.
at0082.1.comment: Kann ein Teildatum sein, z.B. ein Jahr. Das Datenelement bleibt leer wenn die Episode nicht beendet ist und aktuell noch läuft.

at0023.1.description: *Estimate of number of alcohol units consumed. (en)

at0043.1.description: Zusammenfassung des gesamten Alkoholkonsumverhaltens und der Vorgeschichte der Person.
at0043.1.comment: Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement, um eine Beschreibung der Alkoholtrinkgewohnheiten für diese Person aufzuzeichnen oder um unstrukturierte Informationen über den Alkoholkonsum aus bestehenden oder älteren klinischen Systemen in ein archetypisches Format zu integrieren.

at0064.1.description: Angaben zu einem abgegrenzten Zeitraum des Konsums mit einem konsistenten Konsumverhalten.

at0085.1.description: Die verwendete Definition für einen Aufhörversuch, um den Wert für das in diesem Archetyp verwendete Datenelement 'Anzahl der Aufhörversuche' zu bestimmen.
at0085.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: "Konsumierte keinen Alkohol für einen Tag oder länger, mit der Absicht aufzuhören".

at0000.1.description: Informations sommaires ou persistantes sur la consommation d'alcool typique d'un individu.

at0000.description: Informations sommaires ou persistantes sur la consommation d'alcool typique d'un individu.

at0003.description: L'individu est un consommateur actuel d'alcool.

at0005.description: L'individu a déjà consommé de l'alcool mais n'est pas un consommateur actuel.

at0006.description: L'individu n'a jamais consommé d'alcool.

at0013.description: Date à laquelle cet épisode a commencé.
at0013.comment: Il peut s'agir d'une date partielle, par exemple, seulement une année.

at0014.description: *Date when the individual last consumed alcohol. (en)
at0014.comment: Peut être une date partielle, par exemple, seulement une année. Les définitions d'une "Date d'arrêt" varient énormément et peuvent être définies en utilisant l'élément de données "Définition des données d'arrêt" dans la section Protocole de cet archétype. Cette date sera identique à la "date de fin d'épisode" pour l'épisode le plus récent. Cette date pourrait être utilisée par les services d'aide à la décision pour déterminer si la personne risque de rechuter, par exemple au cours des 12 premiers mois suivant son départ.

at0015.description: Date ou date partielle à laquelle l'individu a commencé à consommer fréquemment ou régulièrement de l'alcool pour la première fois, mais généralement de façon non quotidienne .
at0015.comment: Cet élément de données enregistre le moment où un mode de consommation régulier a commencé, plutôt que le tout premier goût d'alcool. Le premier goût peut survenir à un très jeune âge, puis le fait de ne pas boire avant le milieu de l'adolescence. Dans ce cas, c'est le schéma du milieu de l'adolescence qui est cliniquement significatif. Pour différencier les modes de consommation d'alcool, il faut les enregistrer dans d'autres éléments de cet archétype, par exemple dans la section "Par épisode".

at0016.description: Date globale d'arrêt
at0016.comment: Il peut s'agir d'une date partielle, par exemple, seulement un an. Cette date pourrait être utilisée par les guides d'aide à la décision pour déterminer si la personne risque de rechuter, par exemple dans les 12 premiers mois depuis qu'elle a arrêté de fumer.

at0019.description: Récit supplémentaire sur toute la consommation d'alcool qui n'a pas été saisie dans d'autres champs.

at0022.description: Dernière mise à jour

at0023.description: *Estimate of number of alcohol units consumed. (en)

at0025.description: Nombre total de fois où l'individu a tenté d'arrêter de consommer de l'alcool au cours de cet épisode.

at0081.description: Identification d'un épisode de consommation d'alcool - soit sous la forme d'un numéro dans une séquence et/ou d'un événement nommé.

at0084.description: Ne pas consommer de boissons alcoolisées tous les jours.

at0108.comment: Il est préférable d'utiliser l'option de texte codé lorsque cela est possible. Sinon, il est possible d'utiliser un ensemble de valeurs ou des terminologies locales pour enregistrer des types spécifiques de boissons alcoolisées. Par exemple : vin rouge ou blanc ; brandy ou whisky ; bière normale ou faiblement alcoolisée ; ou alcool dénaturé (alcool méthylique) comme forme spécifique de spiritueux rectifiés.
